column1: I've finally arrived
at this weird altar.
Now, the one summoning these shooting stars, show yourself!
Oh my, this is quite unexpected.
I can't believe that even Kage failed to stop you.
You're really powerful.
This is nothing
compared to you, who's able to summon so many shooting stars.
Oh, really? Thanks for the compliment.
With that said, by summoning such a ridiculous amount of shooting stars in the sky,
what is your motive?
It's to realize my wish.
I noticed that the power of a single shooting star is too limited,
so if I were to summon a meteor shower, then the situation might be different.
Realizing a wish?
Is that really true!?
It's true.
Have you ever heard of the “Star God”?
It is said that by praying to the shooting stars, the power of faith will eventually pass on to the Star God.
This is how wishes come true.
So that's how it is.
In the end, it's about gathering faith?
If you're going to be taking the faith of Gensokyo, I won't stand around doing nothing!
Gathering faith?
I see.
So that's how you see it, huh?
But no matter what,
without the power of faith, it is very difficult to conduct the prayer ritual.
In that case, if you are here to stop it, you will have to fight against me!
Bring it on! A battle for faith!
O dazzling Star God!
Convert these shooting stars into magical power!
Protect my people!
